Selected Answer: AD
Relationship Characteristic are 8Rs :
Retain All measures values
represent unmatched measures as zero with ZN()
remove unmatched values with filters
recover unmatched dimensions with measures
full domains remain for dimension from a single table
relevant dimension domains are shown accross tables
replicate measures across lower levels of detail in the viz only
resolve aggregations to the measures native level of detail

for C : relationship still can be use when we select live connection to data

questions.question_text: What are three reasons to use joins instead of relationships? (Choose three.)

comments.content: I am using 2023.1 version and saw that data can be joined from different connections.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/datasource_datamodel_faq.htm#can-i-use-joins-between-logical-tables
Use joins only when you absolutely need to. Situations where you might still use joins include when you want to:
• Continue to use a data source from a pre-2020.2 version to Tableau that you have upgraded to 2020.2 (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bypr1QPclao), Join only can be done between data that come from the same connection.
• Explicitly use a specific join type
• Use a data model that supports shared dimensions
• Join need to implement row level security

Note for E : In Join and Relationship, both can connect to multiple database

Selected Answer: ACD
Correct answer ACD

choices.C: You need to use row-level security.
choices.D: You need to use a data model that supports shared dimensions.
choices.E: You need to connect to multiple databases.
choices.A: You need to use a specific join type.
choices.B: You need to create an extract that will have multiple tables.

choices.D: An extract reduces the amount of data stored on a client computer as compared to a live data connection.
choices.E: A live connection to a data source can be slow due to network and user traffic, whereas a connection to an extract improves performance.
choices.A: A live connection to a data source provides the best performance for data connections.
choices.B: Calculated fields perform better in workbooks connected to extracts than in workbooks with live connections to a data source.
choices.C: Extracts are stored in memory (RAM), resulting in faster query performance as compared with live data connections.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Extracts give better performance than live connections but create .hyper file in client computer

Selected Answer: BCE
B C and E

Selected Answer: BCD
B. Calculated fields can perform better in workbooks connected to extracts because extracts allow Tableau to pre-process and optimize the data, including calculated fields, resulting in faster query performance.

C. Extracts are stored in memory (RAM), which can result in faster query performance compared to live data connections that query data from a remote data source over a network.

D. Extracts reduce the amount of data stored on a client computer because they store a snapshot of the data, whereas live data connections query data from the data source each time the workbook is opened or refreshed, potentially requiring more data to be transferred over the network.

Selected Answer: BCE
BCE:
Live = Needs highspeed itnernet and continuos package movment
Extract = Better for large datasets (specially when calculating fields)
B,C and E

Selected Answer: BCE
Same for Power BI

https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/extracting_data.htm
BCE
Extracts are advantageous for several reasons:
1. Supports large data sets: You can create extracts that contain billions of rows of data.
2. Help improve performance: When you interact with views that use extract data sources, you generally experience better performance than when interacting with views based on connections to the original data.
3. Support additional functionality: Extracts allow you to take advantage of Tableau functionality that's not available or supported by the original data, such as the ability to compute Count Distinct.
4.Provide offline access to your data: If you are using Tableau Desktop, extracts allow you to save and work with the data locally when the original data is not available. For example, when you are traveling
B C and D

Selected Answer: D
we can do this with 2 way options :
options 1 - https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/formatting_fonts_beta.htm
 select Format > Font. A Format Font control pane will open. This control pane will let you customize the text in the view. 

option 2 - In Tableau Desktop, you can right-click (control-click on Mac) the axis, and then select Format. In web authoring, you can click the arrow button on an axis, and then select Format.
